abstract:
Abstract
We study counting propositional logic as an extension of
propositional logic with counting quantifiers. We prove that the
complexity of the underlying decision problem perfectly matches the
appropriate level of Wagner‚Äôs counting hierarchy, but also that the
resulting logic admits a satisfactory proof theoretical
treatment. From the latter, a type system for a probabilistic
ŒªùúÜ\lambda-calculus is derived in the spirit of the Curry-Howard
correspondence, showing the potential of counting propositional
logic as a useful tool in several fields of theoretical computer
science.
